SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Developer Experience: Maintain and Extend Your Storefront Code More Reliably

Implement your solution's extensions or customizations with less noise and deeper integration between the B2B Commerce for Visualforce managed package and the Salesforce Platform.

Extend My Wallet Functionality More Easily
If your storefront allows a buyer to manage stored payments from the My Wallet section of the My Account page, implement customized functionality with fewer headaches. You can now specify whether to use the legacy extension hook or standard B2B Commerce for Visualforce global API for fetching and removing stored payments in the My Wallet section.
Maintain Your Storefront's Third-Party JavaScript Dependencies
Continue to deliver a trusted storefront experience for your buyers and keep your storefront's third-party dependencies up to date. This release updates the default versions of several open-source JavaScript libraries distributed with the managed package.
Improve Page Performance When Returning Data from the API
Squeeze extra performance improvements from your storefront pages and take advantage of deeper integration between the Salesforce Platform and the B2B Commerce for Visualforce managed package. This release refactors the logic that transforms data that a B2B Commerce for Visualforce API call returns: the transformation now occurs within the platform instead of the managed package. As a result, you can provide a faster storefront experience when showing data returned from an API query.
Process Deprecated Apex Classes and Visualforce Pages
Keep your org data lean and tidy by removing unused or deprecated Apex classes and Visualforce pages.
